<instructions>
1. The URL suggests the company name is "Spotonproduct", but this may be an ASCII-only slug that differs from the actual display name
2. Look for the company name mentioned across multiple sources (headings, labels, links, description)
3. Prioritize:
   - Names that appear consistently across multiple sources
   - Proper capitalization and special characters (prefer "Zūm" over "Zum" or "Ridezum")
   - Names in navigation links to company homepage
   - Names in form labels like "Why do you want to work at [Company]?"
4. If multiple variations exist (e.g., "Ridezum" in URL vs "Zūm" on page), choose the properly formatted display name
5. Return ONLY the company name with no additional text or explanation
6. If no clear company name can be extracted from the context, return the URL company name as fallback
</instructions>

<output_format>
[Company Name Only]
</output_format>
